page.title: 02GENERAL DESCRIPTION (ROADS)
page.content:
{Astley}and{Dunley}have the typical West Worcestershire scenery of undulating small hills and valleys criss-crossed by a network of brooks and country lanes, many only one car- width; the whole area gradually sloping down from the Abberley Hills in the West (283m/928ft) and Hurtle Hill in the North (134m/440ft) eastwards to the Severn Valley.
There is only one major road, which practically bisects the block, running diagonally N.E. to S.W.. This is the {A451}Kidderminster/Stourport/Gt.Witley road, which joins the{A443}Worcester/ Tenbury road at Gt.Witley. The{B4196} secondary road (just off the map)which joins the {A451}at Areley Kings, runs N./S. skirting the eastern edge of the block and eventually joins the {A443 at{Holt. }
